description: Fascinated by contrasts in scale, O’Keeffe often juxtaposed enlarged still-life elements with distant landscapes. Here, vibrant blossoms are magnified against the dry, steep hills surrounding her New Mexico home. She admired the land's colors, later equating them with paints: “All the earth colors of the painter’s palette are out there.... The light Naples yellow through the ochers—orange and red and purple earth—even the soft earth greens."
title: Red Hills with Flowers
